About Crossover Health
Crossover makes remarkable health possible by bringing people, their doctors, data, and benefits together under one connected system of health. We’ve built an entirely new category of primary care providing one simple place to go for trusted care—in person, online, anytime. We are working with the most innovative employer partners to integrate disconnected health and wellness benefits with tech-enabled services which allows our partners to increase access to care, decrease spending, and deliver an unrivaled experience for employees near and far.
Job Description
This role will lead Crossover’s Data Science and Analytics teams, responsible for recruitment, training, and management of our Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Data Architects.
Your team is charged with the design, development, maintenance, growth, quality, analysis, and presentation of Crossover’s growing data assets. This includes managing strategic data initiatives; fielding, prioritizing, and delivering data requests; and, fostering a data-driven culture by supporting other teams in the consumption and use of our data. This includes resourcing key initiatives as well as the democratization of Crossover’s data via data presentation and self-service platforms.
You will work with organizational leaders and business stakeholders across the company to drive the use of data to grow, optimize, and empower internal teams and external partners. Your team will collaborate closely with Crossover’s Outcomes team, both in terms of supporting the use of data, but also working directly on specific analysis and initiatives. You will cultivate an environment that fosters an experiment-first mentality, including creating hypotheses, directing experiments and analyses to validate, and working with cross-functional teams to turn those findings into decisions, business strategy, and meaningful changes to Crossover’s care model, products, operations, and ultimately improved care of our members.
Job Responsibilities
Translate Crossover’s near and long-term objectives into a strategic vision and roadmap for Data Science and Analytics. Develop and execute a plan to deliver the vision.
Using your proven ability to level-up talent, manage and grow a high-performing team of data scientists, analysts, and architects.
Implement data science lifecycle and agile frameworks to improve quality, responsiveness, and predictability of delivery.
Champion data-driven decision making across the organization via implementation of a self-service business intelligence platform, training, and operational support.
Collaborate cross-functionally to explore and find growth levers and optimization opportunities
Ensure data assets are designed and maintained to a high standard of quality, integrity, and accuracy.
Ensure data products are well tested and are well supported operationally.
Partner closely with Product and Engineering leaders to drive product development decisions and priorities using analytical frameworks and a data-first approach.
Required Qualifications
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, AI, Statistics, or related Quantitative field, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
7+ years of related work experience with progressively increasing responsibility
5+ years of healthcare industry or relevant related experience
3+ years of people management experience
Experience working in a cross-functional product development environment
Shipped enterprise scale data products
Ability to explain and discuss technology, data, and findings with colleagues and clients with various disciplines and technology/data literacy.
Working knowledge of various data store/query and related technologies, such as RDBMS, NoSQL, map/reduce, stream processing, document stores, Lucene-based search engines, graph databases, RDF/SPARQL, etc., coupled with a demonstrated ability to select and architect the appropriate technology solutions
Working knowledge of state of the art algorithms, tools and best practices for regression, classification, clustering, network analysis, NLP, and other quantitative analytic methodologies.
Expertise in common data science and visualization tooling such as R, python, Tableau, shiny, TensorFlow, etc.
Strong interpersonal skills with a bias for cross functional collaboration.
Experience working remotely with a distributed team
Kept quality, patient safety, and security a top priority in your deliverables
Continuously sought and embraced opportunities to build upon your skills and knowledge

At Talkdesk, we are disruptive risk-takers, don't have a traditional way of doing things, and will do whatever it takes to build a product that improves customer experiences. We help people solve problems in moments that matter.

Join the adventure and grow with us. With $268 million in funding and more than 1,800 customers, we're revolutionizing the industry of contact centers. Join a hyper-growth company that's innovative, bold, and ambitious. Be a part of the future of technology and make an impact on an evolving industry. If you're a self-starter and hungry to learn, apply now and enjoy the ride.

We're looking for the rare breed of data scientist who loves to use their expertise to solve business problems. Your models won't languish in the lab. They will go to production, where they will impact the daily lives of millions of people.


What are we doing?

At Talkdesk we are reimagining how people experience contact centers, helping our customers create long lasting and meaningful relations with their customers. The capacity to make sense of the message that is being conveyed when we communicate has been reserved to humans alone, but we are building the next generation of solutions that will mimic our ability to understand language, ensuring that the customer needs are always well understood and efficiently handled. We are a growing team of curious and talented people that are focused on leveraging the power of Natural Language Processing, audio signal processing, and machine transcription, to deliver added value to our customers.


What do we need?

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist. We need someone that is a natural problem solver, who likes to be challenged, has the drive to explore and is committed to quality. We expect you to be a truly team player, reliable and easy to communicate with. You will have to leverage different techniques to deliver state of the art solutions around natural language understanding and generation. More specifically, you will have to:

Focus on delivering working products/models to production. We don't do pure science at Talkdesk. We do products. We're looking for data scientists who geek out on solving business problems and impacting millions of people's daily lives.
Explore, clean and transform large datasets of unstructured data;
Analyze complex problems and recommend adequate solutions according to the identified requirements;
Apply, combine and fine tune different Natural Language Processing techniques to achieve the best results;
Design, implement and maintain scalable and performant architectures to support the idealized solutions.


What are we looking for?

Experience developing, delivering and operating machine learning-based software in production in the cloud.
Familiarity with NLP tasks (e.g. Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Topic Modeling, Summarization, etc);
Familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms (Neural Networks, SVM, Markov Models, Decision Trees, etc);
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc).
Familiarity with MLFlow is a plus.


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to solve military intelligence challenges. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll support the development and application of data mining, analysis, aggregation, fusion, and visualization to process, analyze, and integrate data and information that facilitates research, analysis, production and dissemination of Scientific and Technical Intelligence (S&TI) and General Military Intelligence (GMI) assessments. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our nation's leaders.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
Experience in the application of mathematical, statistical, or data science analytics
Experience in processing, tagging, and indexing unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets
Experience developing research designs, including formulating testable questions, identifying and defining key concepts and variables, and matching appropriate methods to problems
Experience in data project management, including cleaning and preparing data and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets
Experience in creating mathematical models and coding in R, Python, and Matlab
Experience in using text and web analytics for establishing and expanding keyword searches and using bibliometric analysis tools to perform horizon scans and deep dives into identified S&T research fields
Knowledge of data analysis, including manipulating datasets and interpreting findings using a mix of programs and environments and techniques
TS/SCI clearance
BA or BS degree and 8+ years of experience in the application of mathematical, statistical or data science analytics or MA or MS degree and 6+ years of experience in the application of mathematical, statistical or data science analytics
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
 At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the chance to:
access online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participate in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government
You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

About GrowthBook
Here at GrowthBook we are building an open source A/B testing platform and transforming the way product decisions are made. The top 1% of companies spend thousands of hours making their own highly custom A/B testing platforms. We’ve created GrowthBook to give all companies the power and flexibility of a custom in-house experimentation system without having to build it themselves.
The world of product development is increasingly moving towards data-driven decision making, and the best way to objectively measure the impact of a product is with A/B testing. Top companies already know this, and test everything they ship. As these methods spread, A/B testing will increasingly be part of all product development processes, and will require a new set of tools which are highly integrated and customized to the product and data. GrowthBook is that platform.
Since we launched in May 2021, we’ve added over 1,500 stars on GitHub, and we are the most popular active open source experimentation platform. We’re used by hundreds of companies, and are working closely with fast-growing and large early adopters to help shape our product. Our business has increased 7x in August alone.
Our platform is built using modern tech by very experienced engineers, and backed by top investors. We believe in open source and product-led growth, and we’re focused on building something awesome that our users love.
GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.

Job Description
Data Science & Engineering is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. The Data Science & Engineering team acts as the impact multiplier for Shopify’s product teams, putting over 11 petabytes of data to work to make our merchants more successful. From delivering merchandising insights, to optimizing shipping and processing rates, to reducing credit card fraud, to ad campaign recommendations - our Data Scientists deliver solutions from pipeline to platform via an array of open source tools.
We are looking for a Senior Data Science Manager to lead the team that partners with our Commercial Data Science team. The Commercial team is a rapidly growing area within Shopify that plays a vital role in delivering on this vision by reaching entrepreneurs around the world and helping them succeed on Shopify. The Commercial team’s mission is to empower the most entrepreneurs to succeed. Commercial Data Science and Engineering builds data-informed growth strategies and data products that enable merchants to come, stay and grow on Shopify.
What your role will look like:
Working closely with an interdisciplinary team, you and your team will tackle challenging marketing, commercial and growth-related problems. We build strong data foundations, anomaly detection tools, and reporting frameworks to empower the growth organization to make great decisions quickly.
Some of the Data Science & Engineering team members you’ll work with:
Ella Hilal, Director of Data Science, Growth and Revenue
Kiran Jain, Director of Data Science, Growth
Shopify team members you’ll work closely with:
Morgan Brown, VP Growth
Qualifications
You will need to have:
Data Experience at scale: You’ve been a leader in multiple tech companies where analytics on top of massive data sets drives product/business decisions and results in powerful data products. You have a strong background in machine learning including experience implementing models and productionizing innovative end-to-end machine learning systems.
